topic.title: Grey Window on Linux With the Compiz / Beryl Window Manager

section.p: I try to run on Linux with the Compiz / Beryl window manager but I get only a grey window which does not respond to user actions. Sometimes the window responds to user actions but after opening and closing an dialog or after resizing the window or a view of the window the content of this window becomes grey and it does not respond to user actions. What is wrong?

Sun Microsystems' Java virtual machine does not support the Compiz window manager and the Beryl one very well. It is expected that better support for Compiz / Beryl will be added in future versions of their Java virtual machine. You should turn off the special effects of the Compiz / Beryl window manager before starting the application or switch to other window manager.
